Name: Riyadh
Description: The capital and largest city of Saudi Arabia, located in the center of the country, known for its modern architecture, shopping, and cultural landmarks.

Name: Mecca
Description: A holy city in Islam, located in western Saudi Arabia, home to the Masjid al-Haram and the Kaaba, the most sacred site in Islam.

Name: Medina
Description: The second holiest city in Islam, located in western Saudi Arabia, home to the Prophet s Mosque, the burial place of Prophet Muhammad.

Name: Eastern Province
Description: A major region in the eastern part of Saudi Arabia, known for its oil reserves, industrial areas, and the city of Dammam.

Name: Jizan
Description: A coastal region located in the southwest of Saudi Arabia, known for its agriculture, beaches, and proximity to the Red Sea.

Name: Asir
Description: A mountainous region in the southwestern part of Saudi Arabia, known for its cooler climate, forests, and the city of Abha.

Name: Tabuk
Description: A region in the northwestern part of Saudi Arabia, known for its archaeological sites and proximity to the Red Sea coast.

Name: Hail
Description: A region located in the north-central part of Saudi Arabia, known for its vast desert landscapes and historical landmarks.

Name: Najran
Description: A region located in the southern part of Saudi Arabia, near the border with Yemen, known for its agricultural production and historical sites.

Name: Northern Borders
Description: A region located in the northernmost part of Saudi Arabia, sharing borders with Jordan, Iraq, and Kuwait, known for its desert landscapes and strategic location.

Name: Qassim
Description: A region located in the central part of Saudi Arabia, known for its agriculture, particularly date farming, and the city of Buraydah.

Name: Baha
Description: A region in the southwestern part of Saudi Arabia, known for its mountainous terrain, cooler climate, and historical sites.
